website_summaries.verdict: The URC Digital R50's successful combination of good ergonomics, solid design, and easy programmability makes it a good alternative to Logitech Harmony universal remotes.
pros: easy, wizard-based programming using built-in screen--no need to connect to a PC
capability to learn from other remotes
large, superbright screen with eight contextual hard buttons
cons: button layout is good, but could be better
some programming functions could be more straightforward
costs almost twice as much as similar, competing models

customer_reviews.title: Get it while you can, this model has been declared obsolete
customer_reviews.text: Thank goodness you can still get these as this model has been declared obsolete. Don't like the newer models. The one I had had lasted around 10 years but finally must have gotten a crack in the board as it began to act erratically on certain sections of buttons. All is good again although manually reprogramming this thing is a pain in the rear. Wish there was a way to import and export the programming. Fortunately for me, the old one still worked well enough to transfer all my custom button programmings.
customer_reviews.author: Ish Kabible

customer_reviews.title: Not totally "universal"
customer_reviews.text: I was a little disappointed with this purchase because it is not what I would call "universal". Yes it does recognize my very old stereo system (circa 1990) and my very old television (circa 1995). However, in many cases the only control it provides is to turn the equipment on and off, or to turn the volume up and down. On my old stereo for example, I could not turn the bass on and off. I have a much newer stereo which has pre-programmed sound effects (like Jazz, R&B, Rock, Pop, Latin etc) and the remote does not provide an option to switch between these different sound effects.
customer_reviews.author: Jaffa23

customer_reviews.title: Great remote! Wish some of the buttons were a little bigger.
customer_reviews.text: We ordered this remote because our normal Dish remote was slowly breaking and we didn't want to pay Dish for the same crappy remote they always send. So we took a chance with this remote. I took off a star just because there is a steep learning curve with this remote. It was easy to set up but once you get it going some of the most important buttons are the smallest (making it hard to get used to). I use the fast forward button the most but it is hidden and I would spend about 30 seconds staring at the remote trying to find the button. Otherwise, I really like the remote and the "favorites" button. I would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: twin mom

customer_reviews.title: Great universal remote
customer_reviews.text: Does everything I need it to. Can program to pretty much any device out there, and learn devices that aren't already in it. The menu can be a little confusing, but no real complaint at all. Completely removed all the other remotes in our living room (used to have 5). I got it for $59.00 on Amazon, not sure how much it is now or if it's even available, but if you find it, I highly recommend it. Update (3/30/19): Still goin. It’s sometimes double pushing buttons, but isn’t too annoying. I wish these were still available as all the others out there now seem to offer less.
customer_reviews.author: Green Man

customer_reviews.title: Great update to the traditional URC remotes
customer_reviews.text: If you have ever come from programming one of the traditional URC remotes, the R50 is a pleasure. The onscreen prompts make it super easy to set up and it's got gobs of memory and programmability. The macro function is the best: very easy to use and works like a charm. And the on board code library and access to it is as easy as pie. Gone are the days where you had to enter in numbers from a chart and hope you punched them in right. And, of course, the learning function and button editing function allow you to customize screens to your heart's delight: activity based or component based, you're in charge.
customer_reviews.author: tonygeno

customer_reviews.title: Should Have Bought This Sooner
customer_reviews.text: Why didn't I buy an R50 Universal Remote sooner? It is so-o-o-o sweet, having one remote instead of five to manage my home theater system. Like other reviewers have said, there's a definite learning curve. However, once over the hump, you wonder how you ever got along without this gadget. The most notable assets for me are: 1) good solid feel and heft; 2) amazingly huge preloaded database of device remote codes; 3) ability to create and store powerful, complex macros to manage multiple devices with one button; 4) well designed buttons and ergonomics; 5) great bang-for-the-buck. I highly recommend the R50 Universal Remote. Don't wait any longer.
customer_reviews.author: J. Chinn

customer_reviews.title: REMOTED CONTROL
customer_reviews.text: This is the fourth universal remote i have. One for each TV and DVD. It is much easier to learn the where the buttons are on one remote then to keep tract where the buttons are on the different remotes. This remote I use for the Main TV center and operates, TV, 3DVR, 2 CD's, mini disk, amp. 2 HD Video Cams.VCR and a cassette deck. I had A Harmony Remote which came with a TV -I tried it and returned. This does not require a computer and is easy to operate.
customer_reviews.author: John Mckee

customer_reviews.title: It Works, And Works Very Well!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace an older Universal model when I upgraded my components. It works great, is easy to program (great on-screen menus), and the pre-set codes actually work on my DVD player (which has NEVER happened on any brand of universal remote I have owned). The buttons are very tactile and positive. It actuates my components faster than my old Universal. It is super customizable. I can't really think of a negative. Everything is there for TV, pre-amp and amp, DVD/CD, Apple TV, etc. I would happily buy again. My old Universal remote is going to the bedroom with the old system--it still works after 7+ years.
customer_reviews.author: dbx820

customer_reviews.title: Works Great and Easy Programming
customer_reviews.text: The R50 internal programming results in a significant number of functional buttons without teaching, which is well beyond my older URC 20 remote. Learning commands and macros is very easy. It learned all commands from several old device remotes with no difficulty. Nice not to need a computer to program. Using 4AA batteries allows the highest IR strentgh of any remote I've used so the remote does not have to be pointed at the device. I like the look and button layout but it takes a few days to get used to the narrow arrow key buttons.
customer_reviews.author: rpij

customer_reviews.title: Great for the Pricde
customer_reviews.text: I needed a replacement for our lost Logitech remote, which we liked very much, but I didn't want to spend as much as would have been required to get a similar model. Although I had read about the totally inadequate help available from the "manual," I decided to try it. Perhaps I'm not as smart as some of the other reviewers; it took me a few hours to get the hang of programming it. There's no way to change a single line of a macro, for example. If it wasn't perfectly programmed, you simply have to delete it and start over. However, the end result is great. We're very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Cheapster

customer_reviews.title: easy and intuitive; does exactly what you hope it does - makes managing your devices a breeze.
customer_reviews.text: Great remote with easy to use buttons - and instructions available on it's screen. I just wish it lit up when using it, but I knew it didn't when I bought it. It does have a button on the side that lights up the keys should you need. All in all a very easy and intuitive little remote that is quite simple to operate - even for techno-idiots like myself.
customer_reviews.author: Greg A.

customer_reviews.title: Top Notch Build Quality, but not a Harmony
customer_reviews.text: I pulled the trigger on this after reading some favorable reviews on this remote. But, after 2 hours of trying to configure the remote and STILL not having it play nicely with some of my equipment and fumbling with the "copy and paste" and "Macros", I'm returning for a Harmony 650, which supports less devices, but the setup will transfer over from my current Harmony using the provided software. I would not recommend this product to anyone looking for a "quick and easy" setup as the instructions are joke and the setup is not clear what so ever. Avoid and look in the direction of a Logitech Harmony.
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: Great Remote Control
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to use and program with excellent range. I've always been impressed with infrared capabilities of this particular brand's remotes and as with the previous ones you don't need a direct line of sight to the device, however it gets there the signal makes it so this is one of best things about the remote. The buttons have a nice feel to them and the back has a nice non slip backing which prevents slipping. The macros are easy to program and very effective, I prefer this style of programming as compared to the Harmony. There's nothing that is missing in terms of features. Very well done and a steal at this price.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne

customer_reviews.title: URC R50
customer_reviews.text: This is my firsst universal remote and I am replacing 4 remotes with this one. There are many built in codes, and learning function is also excellent. I haven't tried macros yet but I'm already loving it. And build quality is very good too. And I do not miss the manual, on-screen directions are very clear. Minor complaints: - It becomes noticeably heavy with 4 AAA battery cells - Navigation keys are buried so you might hit other buttons often - I would have liked it little smaller and less space b/w the buttons but that's just me 4.5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Bhushan A

customer_reviews.title: Works but.... well.... its OK.
customer_reviews.text: I got this to use with my cable box, surround system, HD projector, WDTV, and my HDMI swapper. It indeed works but sometimes will mix up the keys and perform the wrong functions. For example, I'll turn off my surround system and the WDTV will power on. Clearly this could be me just programming it wrong, I accept that. Although overall it works and allows me to use one remote. The instructions could be more detailed as they are a bit low on information but it does somewhat help. Overall, I'd recommend this product. Its nothing amazing but it works.
customer_reviews.author: Antonio Stevens

customer_reviews.title: Still working great after many years
customer_reviews.text: I've had this remote for several years now and it is still working great. I have it configured with my favorite channels and works well controlling the TV, sound system, and cable box. I haven't had any issues trying to use it to operate them where I would need the original remotes.
customer_reviews.author: M. Wiesen

customer_reviews.title: The macros are difficult to program
customer_reviews.text: This remote uses macros to move between several different devices that require different functions, but I'll be damned if I could get it to work properly for me. I'm not a novice when it comes to electronic or digital machines, but i simply could not get it to do a macro that moved, say, from playing a DVD back to watching TV or vice versa. I'm going back to the Logitech, which is cheaper and software driven (i.e. programmed through your computer). Save your money and buy a Logitech remote.
customer_reviews.author: Paul J. Morris II

customer_reviews.title: No Discrete keys for Yamaha audio
customer_reviews.text: After a rather steep learning curve ( I'm not a young techno wiz) it turns out that I can't use the built in volume controls because there are not any codes that worked for my new Yamaha soundbar audio system. I used the learn function, but that doesn't allow the use of the volume hard keys. I still have to use the Yamaha remote for volume because it's easier than going through menus looking for it inside the audio device buttons. I will keep looking for the right remote, this isn't it. Unfortunately there is no way to know if it will have codes for your system until you buy it and try it.
customer_reviews.author: Rochelle

customer_reviews.title: Please don't.... just don't.
customer_reviews.text: Broke in 3 weeks. Disappointing interface and I program CNC milling machines and lathes for a living and could not figure out the setup even with a manual. Won't let me return it. Every time I see this remote sitting unused in my cabinet, I get really depressed because it was very expensive and I can't use it. I'll just continue to fumble with my 19 thousand different remotes. I want my Logitech back......
customer_reviews.author: Frank

customer_reviews.title: The perfect universal remote?
customer_reviews.text: A friend had suggested this remote over a year ago... Not exactly sure why I waited, but now that I have this remote, I realize just how right he was. I have one remote in my living room, another in my master bedroom (surround sound is everywhere, and thus I have multiple devices to control in each room). As other reviews have pointed out, setting the macros takes some getting used to/adjustment, but once you have figured out how to set it up, using the remote is a breeze.
customer_reviews.author: elwademd

customer_reviews.title: Replaced all of my remotes. Can set up macros ...
customer_reviews.text: Replaced all of my remotes. Can set up macros. I press on and it will turn on my Satallite Receiver, my audio receiver, set my audio receiver to TV and turn on the TV. Can be programed to control anything. I use a repeater because my equipment is hidden in a cabinet behind a wooden door.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Very user friendly and much more convenient than having four remotes like I did before
customer_reviews.text: So much easier to work than I expected it to be. Very user friendly and much more convenient than having four remotes like I did before. This remote is built very well and is not cheap feeling like other remotes. Too bad they discontinued this one. The newer model of this one isn't nearly as nice.
customer_reviews.author: Nina Dusek

customer_reviews.title: Very nice
customer_reviews.text: Bought this remote for Fathers day. My Son set it up in a flash, said all he did was held another remote to it and it picked it right up. My husband did not have a problem setting up too. It works very well, the only drawback is; that the light does not stay long enough, we tried to fix it but being not successful with it. For the price I payed, its a nice universal remote!
customer_reviews.author: Just me

customer_reviews.title: Love these remotes, way more flexibility than Logitech.
customer_reviews.text: Love these remotes, way more flexibility than Logitech( I have that one and I cringe overtime i have to go through their buggy/inadequate software). Now back to URC, you can program it however you want and if it does not have that device (rare) the just use the learning function.
customer_reviews.author: Vikram

customer_reviews.title: Universal R50 remote
customer_reviews.text: I have had this remote for several years. He has worked great and I only have one complaint with it. When you push a key there is no automatic background lighting. In order to get background lighting you have to press the "light" key. It would be nicer if the light would come on whenever "any" key is pressed. I would still recommend this remote, though.
customer_reviews.author: Gary L. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Outdate library, clunky interface. The extra money for a Logitech Harmony is worth it.
customer_reviews.text: Real pain. I wanted something like my Logitech harmony but you have to constantly switch back and forth between devices no mater how you program it. The "library" is also outdated.
customer_reviews.author: M. Stern

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: I have set up all sorts of UR remotes and really like this one. Even though it may be discontinued it is a great little remote it reminds me of the MX350 with a nice color screen minus the RF. I see some have complained about the set up it was easy with macros it was set up in under and hour and fully tested. That was with learning codes.
customer_reviews.author: Rick M

customer_reviews.title: Love it love it love it!
customer_reviews.text: Ive had this for about a year now, couldn't say i would want anything else. Besides a Harmony One...but that's just because it's touch screen and this one isn't. Besides that it the best controller i have ever had. You can even program the volume from the TV to change when you're under the cable box settings. Plus with the macros you can turn on all your devices at once! PERFECT!
customer_reviews.author: Myles

customer_reviews.title: This Remote Will Satisfy - with Some Tinkering
customer_reviews.text: I was dubious at first, but this remote can do it all short of a pro unit. You must have the patience to program it and be prepared to make custom buttons and "learn" specific functions - this takes time. However, one after the next you will be able to retire the original remotes to a box. I am now at the point of configuring the "macros" for all on and all off.
customer_reviews.author: aces_high

customer_reviews.title: Not simple
customer_reviews.text: The macros are difficult to program. The Logitech we had for years worked much more seamlessly and was user friendly. The cover came off of this within a few months and we had no other option but to super glue it back on. Next time we'll stick with the simple and more logical Logitech.
customer_reviews.author: Motherof2TeenGirls

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Have had this for some time and still love it.
customer_reviews.author: Earl Carlow

customer_reviews.title: Just right for the price
customer_reviews.text: A well thought out remote. At this price you will not find a better deal on the web. Nice color screen. Great macro features to turn on all of your home entertainment components. Do you want to watch a movie... You can program the remote to send multiple commands to switch the appropriate video input and audio receiver setting. I would have gave this 5 stars it had touch screen ability but that might have brought the cost much higher. Highly recommend vs buying comparable logitech remotes for $200 plus...
customer_reviews.author: Ray

customer_reviews.title: Great inexpensive universal remote!!
customer_reviews.text: I receive this remote and programmed my LCD TV, my cable box, audio receiver, BluRay Player, and Apple TV. I put together some macros to turn on/off each designated device when I wanted to use it. My wife loves the "Favorites" feature with the icons that show up. Pretty sweet. If I could complain about anything it would be that the remote cannot detect what device is on or off, which makes for more device buttons and macros. Not a big deal. I replaced this one remote with 5 remote controls. Awesome!!
customer_reviews.author: ryandickneite

customer_reviews.title: URC-R50
customer_reviews.text: I sort of like this remote... It is up to date with the latest technology (e.g., Verizon FiOS set top boxes)... setting up a common volume control was easy... setting up an "all components on/off" has been not so easy... It would be helpful to have some youtube-like on line videos to walk thru some of the features...
customer_reviews.author: R. Weigel

customer_reviews.title: I spent hours searching for a remote to handle multiple ...
customer_reviews.text: I spent hours searching for a remote to handle multiple tvs. This remote handled 5 tvs for me. I wish I could of been able to add tv codes to it but you can,t that is why it is 4 vs 5 stars. I still haven't been able to use the "learn" feature of the remote where it program a tv remote to the URC50. This $50 remote has been discountinued for a $150 URC model. I believe I got my money's worth with this remote.
customer_reviews.author: jeanette saiz

customer_reviews.title: Not working with Blueray Players...
customer_reviews.text: Guess it's because it's an older model, there are no codes for Blueray players, so you will have to teach the remote. Even though that works, using the now programmed remote is cumbersome and takes some getting used to it. The good news is that you can teach that remote anything. Really, I'm even using it to control my IPod...
customer_reviews.author: Marcus

customer_reviews.title: Just ok
customer_reviews.text: Works ok but difficult to program, an ergonomic nightmare and eats batteries
customer_reviews.author: David J.

customer_reviews.title: No Manaul
customer_reviews.text: Comes with a fold out instruction sheet, but no real instruction manual. Basic setups of multiple pieces of electronic gear is simple. Trying to create "macro commands" to simultaneously configure system components to operate together is a trail and error process. I should have spent more money for a remote with better instructions.
customer_reviews.author: John A. Whitehead

customer_reviews.title: Another Nice remote from URC!
customer_reviews.text: I really like the R50. I had no problem setting it up. It is a very powerful remote and seems well suited for my needs. I would say that if you're not comfortable with universal remotes in general, you may have some issues with the setup. A better 'beginner remote' is probably the Harmony 880... But this is a LOT more flexable and able to do exactly what you want if you know what you want to do.
customer_reviews.author: friscodad

customer_reviews.title: Good for the learn feature
customer_reviews.text: The controller works great. Unless you have the existing remotes to use the learn feature off of, don't get this remote. The preprogrammed remotes that you can search for work for most things for power and volume, but things like input and menus and such are a little harder to match up. Even if you can find a good match, the buttons that are programmed into the display are unorganized. In the end, works great, programming is a pain, but if you have existing remotes to program off of, this will be perfect for you to use once it is all set up.
customer_reviews.author: frEskEer

customer_reviews.title: Ok
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a replacement for my harmony 880. This isn't too bad, but it seems to require a lot of effort after using remotes programmed via computer
customer_reviews.author: V. fasano

customer_reviews.title: Needs a better manual
customer_reviews.text: The review by Scrabblefiend is right on, at least as far as I can tell. I haven't got the thing programmed yet. Sure, it's fairly easy to find the right codes to control each device, but I do not find the process of macros very forthright. I think macros might be easy if URC would only print a second page of instructions after the "Quick Start" guide but instead they assume we all learn according to their assumptions. My 15 year old techie son was able to program macros after a couple of tries but also commented on the lack of proper instructions. My 30 year old son told me of how easy his Harmony was to set up.
customer_reviews.author: John D. Patz

customer_reviews.title: Best remote I've found!
customer_reviews.text: This remote is much better than any of the Harmony (or any other brand) remotes I've seen and used. Can learn any code from another remote, and the capability to program multiple steps (macros) is a real plus. The network labels on the screen are a nice touch. Doesn't loose programming when batteries die. I highly recommend this!
customer_reviews.author: Duke

customer_reviews.title: TRIED BUT STILL FRUSTRATED
customer_reviews.text: I tried for over a year to set up a macro for turning multiple devices off at the same time but I still don't get it and URC is absolutely no help whatsoever. I'm going back to Harmony. I don't mind the online setup and at least I know how it works. This remote is obviously for people who have some secret skill I lack.
customer_reviews.author: ginabina

customer_reviews.title: This is a great remote and will learn all infra red commands but ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a great remote and will learn all infra red commands but I have many remotes and it does not clone. I don't know why the MFG did not put clone mode in it. They do it on many of their remotes.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Buck

customer_reviews.title: Not totally intuitive
customer_reviews.text: It took some experimentation, but the unit works with all my components. Getting the macros to work was a challenge. More detailed instructions would have been helpful. Not totally compatible with DirecTV receiver, but it can be made to work.
customer_reviews.author: Brian K White

customer_reviews.title: Very good remote
customer_reviews.text: Best remote for the price out there. Programming is easy with the learn feature. This is my second one. My first one lasted 3 years.
customer_reviews.author: M. Ditta

customer_reviews.title: these are the best!
customer_reviews.text: These are my favorite remotes. I have one I am still using after 5 years, but I bought 2 more, one for another system and then one as a back up.
customer_reviews.author: SIERRA

customer_reviews.title: Such a great and flexible remote
customer_reviews.text: Such a great and flexible remote. You can program in so many ways, and it is not that hard to do, but requires a little patience when reading the instructions. Worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: 50ISH

customer_reviews.title: Good remote, reasonable price
customer_reviews.text: Just set this up tonight. Took about 10 mins with Sony TV, Pioneer receiver, Directv, Roku and Sony Bluray. So far so good. Look for more detail later. Off the cuff, I'll say 3 stars. It's not a 5. But it might be a 4 after I have lived with it a while and done some more testing.
customer_reviews.author: Dutton and Beth Armstrong, Editors

customer_reviews.title: URC-R50
customer_reviews.text: I found the URC-R50 easy to setup. There was a bit of a learning curve, but wasn't hard to figure out. I loved the fact that it could learn the individual functions from my other remotes. The macros function came in handy. I used it to create one button that would turn on the TV, A/V receiver and PVR/Cable box. And I created another button to turn everything off. The one thing I wish it could do is save all my custom settings to the PC. That way I wouldn't have to worry about loosing them if the batteries died. All in all, I think it was a great buy. I love It! So does my wife.
customer_reviews.author: Outpost

customer_reviews.title: awesome bang for the buck
customer_reviews.text: This remote was VERY simple to program for my moderately complicated home theater. And for a comparably featured competitor's remote I would have spent twice the price. It could use a little more customizability, but it ended up making it simple to program, and it always seemed to "guess" the right device code on the first try. I think they put alot of thought into designing the tech in this remote.
customer_reviews.author: mikemech

customer_reviews.title: Great, simple Universal remote, couple small quirks.
customer_reviews.text: I loved its predecessor, but it finally died after good years of use. This new one is so simple and sleek, I love it.The only little quirk is that some buttons are to close to each other, and you can accidentally hit the wrong button, but in a short time you get it figured out. Very good remote.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Young

customer_reviews.title: Well worth it
customer_reviews.text: I've spent almost 10 years looking for a replacement to my trusty old Marantz RC2000 remote, and I finally found one in the URC R50 (especially @ this price). There isn't anything this remote couldn't handle: built-in codes, learned codes, combinations of the two. Easy to set-up and use, this is the first time I've ever used a "Favs" function on any electronics; it's easy to bounce between the "Main" and "Favs" screens. The URC R50 is better than remotes costing 5x as much.
customer_reviews.author: D. Zeff

customer_reviews.title: Super Remote
customer_reviews.text: Excellent alternative to harmony. Lower price and has the advantage of learning from any remote so it does not depend on a database that might not include what you have. The only downside is that al configuration is manual (no USB connection to the PC), but it is understandable for the price.
customer_reviews.author: proshop

customer_reviews.title: Own it Love it
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item as a last ditch effort on universal remotes. Let me just say that after owning the Kemeleon, Logitech, etc, this unit is by far 100% better then all the rest. And it just works! I would highly recommend this remote to anyone that needs to replace their remote.
customer_reviews.author: Sirius in Seattle

customer_reviews.title: Great remote for the price
customer_reviews.text: I read a lot of reviews on this remote before I bought it, some good, some bad, and quite a few mediocre. There are hardly any instructions that accompany the remote because all the programming steps are stored on the remote itself. It took a little bit to understand the on screen instructions, but once you get used to the procedure it's super simple. I had five components programmed with macros in about 20 minutes. Now that I understand the procedure I could do it in about 5 minutes. Don't let the bad reviews scare you away, Iam overall impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Thorman468

customer_reviews.title: 5 remotes cut down to 1
customer_reviews.text: We had 5 remotes stacked up on our coffee table for years. finally got fed up with it and bought the universal R50. Its amazing. very easy to use, and program. excellent learning capabilities. overall a great product for a good price. definitely worth it if you have as many remotes as we do.
customer_reviews.author: Amy P

customer_reviews.title: It's ok
customer_reviews.text: This remote was really easy to program and works with everything I own, including an old Sony component cd burner. I would have rated it higher, but it has a weird glitch where it resets itself to the main programming screen if you move it too quickly. It's a little frustrating, but not enough to return it - thankfully it doesn't lose its programming when it does that. All in all, I'd probably buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Andi Beagle

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Remote for the price!!
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to get an all in one remote because I was tired of switching from 1 thing to the next and having remotes all over the place. This universal replaced 5 remotes easily. Set up was easy and quick. Had all my devices set up within 20 mins. I am so glad I didn't get a logitech. My biggest concern was the rechargeable battery on the logitech. I wanted something with longevity and I have seen to many times where Logitech remotes wouldn't hold a charge because of the old age and connections. Wouldn't recommend any other remote in this price range!
customer_reviews.author: Missionstatment

customer_reviews.title: Great Universal Remote Control
customer_reviews.text: Does almost all that I expect it to do except: time scheduling function. All the fancy features but missing clock and scheduling feature?
customer_reviews.author: Ken-Ou

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Replacment remote controlls DVD/ Sound System ECT
customer_reviews.text: been using this control 3 years my wife loves it replaces a factory 65 "Mitb DLP TV remote that bit the dust

product_meta.title: URC R50 Digital Universal Remote Control for up to 18 Components (Discontinued by Manufacturer)
product_meta.description:
Control up to 18 components with NO internet or PC needed

FROM THE MANUFACTURER



URC-R50 UNIVERSAL REMOTE: SOPHISTICATED, PROFESSIONAL-LEVEL HOME THEATER CONTROL
Having an advanced home theater system can be a great experience. High definition movies and sound, and all your favorite music and TV shows. But the more advanced the system, the more difficult you may be finding it to navigate between all your high-definition sources like your Blu-ray player or cable set-top box. Are you ready to give up the stack of remotes in your living room for a simple single solution that gives you professional-level control of your home theater?

The powerful yet affordable consumer line of universal remotes from Universal Remote Control puts control of your home theater at your fingertips. No need for complicated setups or expensive complete systems--the URC-R50 lets you spend less time wrestling to control your home theater, and more time enjoying it.



Choose from a wide variety of logos for your favorite channels

URC Consumer remote controls: helping you control the experience, one component at a time.

REPLACE UP TO 18 REMOTES WITH ONE URC-R50
Perfect for the advanced DIY, the URC-R50 replaces up to eighteen individual remote controls and offers a customizable color LCD screen, complete with device and TV channel icons, and brightly backlit buttons. URC's Digital R50 works with thousands of home theater produces--even iPod docks--and has simple "Wizard" based set-up options. You'll be able to easily setup your control system so that any member of the family can operate it. No PC or complicated programming is required.

Experience home entertainment like never before with the URC-R50.

SIMPLIFY CONTROLLING YOUR HOME THEATER WITH MACROS
In addition to being a great replacement for up to 18 remote controls, the URC-R50 delivers much more. MacroPower is a very useful way to make a lot of things happen with one button push. For example, in most home theaters, to watch television, the user must turn on the TV, then turn on the Cable Box or the Satellite Receiver, then turn on the Surround Sound system for sound. Instead of pressing all of those buttons one at a time, MacroPower enables you to turn on all of these components, in the sequence you want, with one button push.

The R50 uses MacroPower to allow you turn on your TV, cable box, DVD player and surround sound system all at the same time with the press of one button. The R50 even allows you the option of hiding screens you aren't using and editing text on every LCD button for maximum customization. Have a surround sound system? Use the "Copy and Paste" feature to access your receiver's volume while viewing any device control screen.

The URC-R50 also comes with eight reserved pages to program up to forty-eight favorite channels, complete with station logos.



Replace up to 18 remotes with the URC-R50

SIMPLESOUND TOTAL SYSTEM VOLUME
With SimpleSound, the Volume and Mute buttons always control the sound regardless of what screen is displayed, even those that do not have their own built-in volume control such as TiVO and DVD players. This is set up by using Copy and Paste to copy the commands from your TV or Audio system to the Volume and Mute buttons on all of your other devices. So no matter what, there are no hassles when you quickly need to reduce or mute sound for a phone call or doorbell.

CHANNEL CONTROL "PUNCH THROUGH"
This "Punch Through" enables you to program the R50 remote so that either the Cable or TV Channel Controls (CHANNEL UP, DOWN, LAST, CHANNEL NUMBERS 0-9, +10 and ENTER) will also operate in other component modes on the remote control.

TRANSPORT CONTROL "PUNCH THROUGH"
This "Punch Through" enables you to program the URC-R50 so that DVD or DVR Transport Controls (PLAY, STOP, FF, REW, PAUSE, SKIP and RECORD) will also operate in other component modes on the remote control.

OSD (ON-SCREEN DISPLAY) CONTROL "PUNCH THROUGH"
This "Punch Through" enables you to program the URC-R50 so that CBL or DVD OSD Controls (MENU, GUIDE, INFO, EXIT, SEL and 4 Cursor Controls) will also operate in other component modes on the remote control.

LEARNING MODE
This feature will allow you to literally teach the URC-R50 commands from other remote controls; when the remote is in learning mode, you can line the two remotes facing each other and transfer commands with just a few buttons presses. Press any button on the R50 remote that you want to teach a command to. For example, if you want to teach the MUTE button on the R50 remote the TV Mute command from the other remote, first press the MUTE button on the R50 remote and the TV component button LED light will blink once indicating that the R50 remote is ready to learn the command. This way, your remote is never obsolete--the URC-R50 grows with your home theater.

WHAT CRITICS ARE SAYING ABOUT URC-R50
"The URC R50 is one of the easiest remotes we've ever attempted set up...especially for the non-technically inclined. The packaging includes a one-sheet guide to help you get started, but you really don't even need that. Why? An intuitive setup wizard is ready to take you through the simple steps to get your gear up and running and consolidate your remote controls."
--Krissy Rushing, Digital Trends

"URC Digital R50's successful combination of good design and easy programmability makes it a good alternative to Logitech Harmony universal remotes."
--John Falcone, CNET

"The R50's comfortable ergonomics and bright color screen make it competitive with the higher priced [Logitech] Harmony remotes, and, while it may take a few extra steps, it can accomplish the same kind of intelligent and unified system control that you find on even the most expensive competitive remotes."
--Chris Boylan, Big Picture Big Sound

TECHNICAL SPECIFICATIONS
 * Learning Capability: Up to 1,500 Buttons
 * Macro Capability: 1,500 Macro buttons (up to 255 steps each)
 * Non-Volatile Flash Memory: 32 MBs
 * IR Range (Line-of-Sight via Infrared): 30 - 50 feet
 * Unit Dimensions (W x H x D): 2.3" x 8.9" x 1.1"
 * Unit Weight: 0.55 lbs (with batteries)
 * Gross Unit Weight in Package: 0.9 lbs
 * Power: AA Alkaline x 4 (Included)
 * Warranty: One year including parts & labor



WHICH URC REMOTE IS RIGHT FOR YOU?
